article.headline: Pacific 57, UC Riverside 51
article.story: RIVERSIDE, Calif. -- Allen Huddleston scored 22 points and made five 3-pointers to lead Pacific to a 57-51 victory against UC Riverside on Thursday night. Sam Willard added 17 points for the Tigers (16-11, 8-5 Big West), who moved within a half-game of Cal Poly-San Luis Obispo for second place in the conference standings. Phil Martin had 15 points for the Highlanders (9-17, 4-9), who shot just 35.7 percent (20 for 56) from the floor. Javon Borum's 3-pointer with 4:53 remaining got Riverside within 54-49, but neither team scored until Pat Eveland's shot from beyond the arc restored Pacific's eight-point lead with 1:05 to play. The Highlanders shot 1 for 9 and committed three turnovers down the stretch. Eveland had seven points and 10 rebounds.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
